N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 16.16 - Evidence of receipt of goods

State Regulations
(a) Delivery receipts, inspection reports and other equally satisfactory evidences
of the receipt of goods or the performance of services in support of purchase
vouchers shall be kept on file pending field audit by the Comptroller. When an
inspection report or delivery receipt has been covered by a voucher, it shall
be cancelled or voided in such a manner that it cannot be used in support of a
duplicate claim. (b) Where a copy
of the purchase order is used as a receiving report, quantities ordered shall
be omitted therefrom. The quantities should be noted thereon when received for
comparison with the purchase order and vendor voucher. (c) Delivery receipts and inspection reports
should be signed by the person responsible for their correctness. Notes
